sections.title: 1. Introduction to Cookies
sections.content: This Cookie Policy explains how ByteNodes uses cookies and similar tracking technologies when you visit our website and use our hosting services. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer, smartphone, or other device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently, provide a better user experience, and give website owners useful information about how their sites are being used. At ByteNodes, we are committed to transparency about our use of cookies and protecting your privacy while delivering the best possible experience on our platform.

sections.title: 2. What Are Cookies and How They Work
sections.content: Cookies are small data files that are placed on your device when you visit a website. They contain a small amount of information that allows the website to recognize your device when you return. Cookies serve many functions: they can remember your login credentials so you do not have to enter them every time you visit; they can remember your preferences such as language settings or display options; they can track your browsing behavior to provide personalized content; they can help website owners understand how visitors interact with their sites. Cookies can be either first-party cookies, which are set by the website you are visiting, or third-party cookies, which are set by other domains. Session cookies are temporary and are deleted when you close your browser, while persistent cookies remain on your device for a specified period or until you delete them manually.

sections.title: 3. Types of Cookies We Use
sections.content: ByteNodes uses several categories of cookies to provide and improve our services. Essential Cookies are strictly necessary for the operation of our website and cannot be disabled without affecting basic functionality. These cookies enable core features such as user authentication, session management, security features, and load balancing. Performance Cookies collect anonymous information about how visitors use our website, including which pages are visited most often and how long visitors spend on each page. Functional Cookies allow our website to remember choices you make, such as your username, language preference, or region. Analytics Cookies are used to collect information about how visitors interact with our website to help us compile reports and improve our site.

sections.title: 4. Third-Party Cookies and Services
sections.content: In addition to our own cookies, ByteNodes may use cookies from third-party services to enhance your experience on our website. These third-party cookies may include analytics services such as Google Analytics, which helps us understand how visitors use our site; social media plugins that allow you to share content on platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn; payment processing services that facilitate secure transactions; and customer support chat widgets that enable real-time communication with our support team. Each third-party service has its own privacy policy governing the use of their cookies. We recommend reviewing these policies to understand how your information may be used.

sections.title: 5. How to Manage and Control Cookies
sections.content: You have several options for managing and controlling cookies on your device. Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings preferences. You can typically find these settings in the Options, Settings, or Preferences menu of your browser. You can configure your browser to accept all cookies, reject all cookies, or notify you when a cookie is set so you can decide whether to accept it. You can also delete cookies that have already been stored on your device. Please note that if you choose to block or delete cookies, some features of our website may not function properly, and your user experience may be affected.

sections.title: 6. Cookie Consent and Your Choices
sections.content: When you first visit our website, you may be presented with a cookie consent banner that explains our use of cookies and asks for your consent. By clicking Accept or continuing to use our website, you consent to our use of cookies as described in this policy. You can withdraw your consent at any time by adjusting your browser settings to block cookies or by clearing existing cookies from your device. We respect your right to make informed choices about cookies and are committed to providing you with the information you need.

sections.title: 7. Cookies and Your Privacy
sections.content: We take your privacy seriously and use cookies in accordance with our Privacy Policy. The information collected through cookies is used to improve your experience on our website and provide better services. We do not use cookies to collect personally identifiable information unless you have consented to do so. Any personal information collected through cookies is handled in accordance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Policy. We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the information collected through cookies from unauthorized access.

sections.title: 8. Updates to This Cookie Policy
sections.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technologies, legal requirements, or for other operational reasons. When we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you by posting the updated policy on our website with a revised effective date. We encourage you to review this Cookie Policy periodically to stay informed about our use of cookies. Your continued use of our website after any changes constitutes your acceptance of the updated terms. If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or our use of cookies, please contact us through our support channels.

sections.title: 1. Purpose and Scope of This Policy
sections.content: This Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) defines the acceptable and prohibited uses of ByteNodes hosting services, including but not limited to Virtual Private Servers (VPS), Game Servers, Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) services, Discord Bot Hosting, Website Hosting, and all related infrastructure and network services. This policy applies to all users, customers, resellers, and any other parties who access or use ByteNodes services. The purpose of this policy is to ensure that all users can enjoy reliable, secure, and high-quality hosting services while preventing activities that may harm our infrastructure, other customers, or third parties.

sections.title: 2. General Prohibited Activities
sections.content: Users of ByteNodes services are strictly prohibited from engaging in any activities that are illegal, harmful, fraudulent, or that violate the rights of others. This includes but is not limited to: conducting any illegal activities or activities that violate applicable local, national, or international laws; engaging in fraud, identity theft, or other deceptive practices; infringing upon the intellectual property rights of others, including copyright, trademark, and patent violations; transmitting content that is defamatory, obscene, harassing, threatening, or invasive of privacy; distributing or hosting content that exploits, harms, or endangers children in any way; engaging in activities that could damage the reputation of ByteNodes.

sections.title: 3. Network and System Security Violations
sections.content: Users must not engage in any activities that compromise the security, integrity, or availability of our network, systems, or the systems of others. Prohibited security-related activities include: launching or facilitating Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks, network flooding, or other forms of network attacks against any target; attempting to gain unauthorized access to any computer system, network, data, or information belonging to ByteNodes or third parties; scanning, probing, or testing the vulnerability of any system or network without explicit authorization; intercepting, monitoring, or tampering with network traffic or communications without authorization; distributing or hosting malware, viruses, worms, trojans, ransomware, or any other malicious software.

sections.title: 4. Email and Communication Abuse
sections.content: ByteNodes has a zero-tolerance policy for email abuse and spam. Users are prohibited from: sending unsolicited bulk email (spam) or commercial email without proper consent from recipients; sending email messages that forge, misrepresent, or conceal the sender's identity, origin, or routing information; harvesting, scraping, or collecting email addresses or other contact information without consent; operating open mail relays or open proxies that could be used for spam distribution; sending email that contains malware, phishing links, or other malicious content; engaging in email bombing or overwhelming recipients with excessive messages.

sections.title: 5. Resource Usage and Fair Use
sections.content: Users must use ByteNodes resources responsibly and in accordance with their service plan limitations. Prohibited resource-related activities include: exceeding the allocated resources for your service plan, including CPU, RAM, bandwidth, and storage limits; running cryptocurrency mining operations without explicit written permission from ByteNodes; running resource-intensive applications that negatively impact other customers or our infrastructure; using services in a manner that places an unreasonable burden on our network, servers, or support resources; attempting to circumvent resource limits or quotas through technical means.

sections.title: 6. Content Restrictions and Prohibited Content
sections.content: Users are prohibited from hosting, storing, distributing, or linking to certain types of content on ByteNodes services. Prohibited content includes: any content that is illegal under applicable law, including but not limited to content that violates copyright, trademark, or other intellectual property rights; child sexual abuse material (CSAM) or any content that exploits or endangers minors; content that promotes or facilitates terrorism, violence, or hate crimes; phishing websites, fake login pages, or other content designed to deceive users and steal personal information; pirated software, games, movies, music, or other copyrighted material distributed without authorization.

sections.title: 7. Consequences of Policy Violations
sections.content: ByteNodes takes violations of this Acceptable Use Policy seriously and will take appropriate action against users who violate these terms. Consequences may include: warning notifications for minor or first-time violations, with a specified period to correct the issue; temporary suspension of services while we investigate potential violations; immediate termination of services without refund for serious or repeated violations; permanent ban from using any ByteNodes services in the future; cooperation with law enforcement agencies for illegal activities; legal action to recover damages caused by policy violations.

sections.title: 8. Reporting Violations and Contact Information
sections.content: If you become aware of any violations of this Acceptable Use Policy, please report them immediately to our abuse team. You can report violations by sending an email to support@bytenodes.id with a detailed description of the violation, including any relevant evidence such as screenshots, logs, or URLs. You can also report violations through our support ticket system or by contacting us through our Discord server. We take all reports seriously and will investigate promptly.

sections.title: 9. Policy Updates and Modifications
sections.content: ByteNodes reserves the right to modify this Acceptable Use Policy at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting on our website. We may provide notice of material changes through email or prominent website announcements, but we are not obligated to do so. It is your responsibility to review this policy periodically and stay informed of any updates. Your continued use of our services after any modifications indicates your acceptance of the updated policy.

sections.title: 1. Service Level Commitment
sections.content: ByteNodes is committed to providing reliable and high-quality hosting services to all customers. We guarantee 99.9% network uptime for all our hosting services, including VPS KVM, Game Servers, RDP Windows, Discord Bot Hosting, and Website Hosting.

sections.title: 2. Network Uptime Definition
sections.content: Network uptime is defined as the percentage of time during a given month that our network infrastructure is fully operational and accessible. Downtime is calculated as the total number of minutes during which your services are unavailable due to issues within our control.

sections.title: 3. Service Credit Eligibility
sections.content: If we fail to meet our 99.9% uptime guarantee, eligible customers may receive service credits as compensation based on the uptime percentage achieved.

sections.title: 4. Requesting Service Credits
sections.content: To request a service credit, customers must submit a support ticket within 30 days of the end of the month in which the downtime occurred.

sections.title: 5. Technical Support Response Times
sections.content: ByteNodes provides technical support through multiple channels including our support ticket system, Discord server, WhatsApp, and email.

sections.title: 6. Maintenance and Updates
sections.content: To ensure the continued reliability, security, and performance of our services, ByteNodes performs regular maintenance on our infrastructure.

sections.title: 7. Data Protection and Backup
sections.content: While ByteNodes maintains robust infrastructure, customers are ultimately responsible for maintaining backups of their own data.

sections.title: 8. DDoS Protection Services
sections.content: ByteNodes provides DDoS protection for all hosting services to help mitigate the impact of Distributed Denial of Service attacks.

sections.title: 9. Exclusions and Limitations
sections.content: This Service Level Agreement does not apply to services that are suspended due to Terms of Service violations, beta or free services, or customer-caused issues.

sections.title: 1. Overview and Commitment
sections.content: ByteNodes is committed to customer satisfaction and stands behind the quality of our hosting services. This Refund Policy outlines the conditions under which customers may request refunds for services purchased from ByteNodes. We understand that circumstances may arise where you need to cancel your services, and we aim to handle all refund requests fairly and transparently. Please read this policy carefully to understand your rights and the conditions that apply to refund requests. By purchasing our services, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to this Refund Policy.

sections.title: 2. 30-Day Money-Back Guarantee
sections.content: ByteNodes offers a 30-day money-back guarantee on all new hosting service purchases. If you are not completely satisfied with your hosting service within the first 30 days of your initial purchase, you may request a full refund of your service fees. This guarantee applies only to new customers and their first purchase of a hosting service. The 30-day period begins from the date of service activation, not the date of payment. To qualify for this guarantee, you must submit a refund request before the end of the 30-day period. Refund requests submitted after this period will not be eligible for the money-back guarantee.

sections.title: 3. Eligible and Ineligible Services
sections.content: The following services are eligible for refunds under our 30-day money-back guarantee: VPS KVM hosting plans, Game Server hosting packages, RDP Windows services, Discord Bot hosting, and Website hosting services. The following services and fees are NOT eligible for refunds: domain name registrations and renewals, as these are non-refundable once processed; setup fees and administrative fees; add-on services such as custom domain configurations, SSL certificates, and additional IP addresses; services that have been suspended or terminated due to violation of our Terms of Service or Acceptable Use Policy; services purchased at promotional or discounted rates may have different refund terms.

sections.title: 4. Conditions for Refund Eligibility
sections.content: To be eligible for a refund, the following conditions must be met: the refund request must be submitted within 30 days of service activation for new customers; you must provide a valid reason for the refund request; your account must be in good standing with no outstanding balances or disputes; you must not have violated our Terms of Service or Acceptable Use Policy; you must have made reasonable efforts to resolve any technical issues with our support team before requesting a refund; any promotional credits, bonuses, or discounts applied to your purchase may be deducted from the refund amount.

sections.title: 5. How to Request a Refund
sections.content: To request a refund, please follow these steps: Submit a support ticket through our client portal or contact us via email at support@bytenodes.id. Include your account information, the service for which you are requesting a refund, and a detailed explanation of your reason for the refund request. Our support team will review your request and respond within 2-3 business days. If your refund request is approved, we will process the refund to your original payment method within 7-14 business days, depending on your payment provider.

sections.title: 6. Partial Refunds and Pro-rata Credits
sections.content: In certain circumstances, ByteNodes may offer partial refunds or pro-rata credits instead of full refunds. Partial refunds may be issued when: you have used a significant portion of a prepaid service period; certain components of your service are non-refundable; promotional discounts were applied that would not apply to the refund amount; there are outstanding balances or fees owed on your account. Pro-rata credits may be applied to your account for future services when services are terminated early due to circumstances beyond your control.

sections.title: 7. Chargebacks and Disputes
sections.content: We strongly encourage customers to contact our support team before initiating any chargeback or payment dispute with their payment provider. Chargebacks initiated without first attempting to resolve the issue through our support channels may result in: immediate suspension or termination of all services associated with your account; forfeiture of any refund eligibility; additional fees to cover chargeback processing costs; permanent ban from using ByteNodes services.

sections.title: 8. Service Cancellation and Data Retention
sections.content: When you request a refund and cancel your services, please be aware of the following: all data stored on your hosting account will be permanently deleted within 24-48 hours of service termination; it is your responsibility to backup any data you wish to keep before requesting a refund; once data is deleted, it cannot be recovered; any domain names registered through ByteNodes are not included in refunds and will remain registered unless you request a separate domain cancellation.

sections.title: 9. Exceptions and Special Circumstances
sections.content: ByteNodes may make exceptions to this Refund Policy in special circumstances, including but not limited to: documented medical emergencies or hardships; significant service outages or issues caused by ByteNodes that are not covered under our SLA; billing errors or duplicate charges made by ByteNodes; other exceptional circumstances as determined by our management team. Requests for exceptions must be made in writing and include documentation supporting the request.

sections.content: ByteNodes reserves the right to modify this Refund Policy at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting on our website. We may provide notice of material changes through email or prominent website announcements, but we are not obligated to do so.
